thread.title: Sample "A Taste of the Past" in Grayslake
thread.title_full: Sample "A Taste of the Past" in Grayslake

author: Daily Herald report
title: Sample "A Taste of the Past" in Grayslake
text:
The Grayslake Heritage Center & Museum, 164 Hawley St., Grayslake, will host a special program, "A Taste of the Past," from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 24. Visitors are invited to sample historic Grayslake recipes and share stories of Grayslake restaurants. Please come prepared to discuss your past and present favorite restaurants, memories of dining in Grayslake and favorite family recipes. Museum volunteers and staff will be on hand to record your memories and incorporate them into the new "Food, Family and Tradition: Dining in Grayslake" exhibit that will debut Friday, Nov. 27. Past and present restaurateurs and staff are encouraged to attend and share images, menus and memories. For information, visit www.grayslakeheritagecenter.com , call (847) 543-1745 or email doberg@villageofgrayslake.com. For information about the Grayslake Historical Society, visit www.grayslakehistory.org , call (847) 223-7663 or email charenehan@aol.com.
 News Dining Grayslake
